name: Burn Rubber
overview: Burn Rubber (not to be confused with Burnin' Rubber) is a 1984 top-down racing game for the Commodore 64. It was developed by Jonathan Cook and released as a type-in listing in the book "COMPUTE!'s Second Book of C64 Games" Game Description: The objective of the game is to drive around the track as fast as possible without crashing. You can go as many laps as you like. You can race for points or for time. To end a lap or reset the clock, you must drive the car off the screen at the lower left. There is no top speed, but the faster you go, the harder it is to drive.
